title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.9.30 | 27-04-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Om Agyana Timiran Dhasya Gyanan Janishalakaya Chakshuran Militam Yena Tasmai Sri Gurave Namaha
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras, invoking blessings and paying respects to the spiritual master and the Lord.

segments.key_quote: Thereupon that man who spoke on different subjects with thousands of meanings and who fought on thousands of battlefields protected thousands of men stopped speaking and being completely freed from all bondage withdrew his mind from everything else and fixed his wide open eyes upon the original personality of God at Sri Krishna who stood before him four-handed dressed in yellow garments that glittered and shined.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verse from Srimad Bhagavatam describing Bhishma's final moments, focusing on his detachment and focus on Krishna.

segments.key_quote: Bhishma fixed his attention his eyes his sight completely on Krishna.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on Bhishma's focus on Krishna and explains why Krishna appeared to him in a four-handed Narayana form, emphasizing the personal relationship between the devotee and the Lord.

segments.key_quote: So the same supreme Lord is present in different forms according to the relationship of the devotees with the Lord.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that Krishna manifests in various forms according to the devotee's relationship with Him, highlighting that this relationship is spiritual and transcends material circumstances.

segments.key_quote: The most important form is the human form...The essence of material existence is misery.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the rarity and importance of human life, explaining that its primary purpose is to escape the inherent suffering of material existence.

segments.key_quote: Therefore if one is absorbed in thoughts of the Supreme Lord Sri Krishna, He is sure to go back to Godhead without any doubt.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that true happiness and eternal life are attained by cultivating Krishna consciousness and remembering the Lord at the time of death.

segments.key_quote: Whoever at the time of death quits his body remembering me alone, that means remembering Krishna, at once attains my nature. Of this there is no doubt.
segments.summary: The speaker explains how to achieve perfection in life by constantly thinking of Krishna, even while performing daily duties, and emphasizes the importance of chanting Hare Krishna.

segments.key_quote: Bhakti Yoga is the easy process.
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts Bhakti Yoga with Ashtanga Yoga and Jnana Yoga, highlighting the ease and accessibility of Bhakti Yoga for attaining spiritual liberation.

segments.key_quote: The easiest method of practicing Bhakti is also described as chanting the Hare Krishna Mantra.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by reiterating the importance of chanting the Hare Krishna mantra as the easiest method for practicing Bhakti Yoga and achieving Krishna consciousness, ending with a thank you and Hare Krishna.
